Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats: one on land (like a playground, garden, or forest) and one in water (like a pond or stream).
The student can include a variety of living things in each habitat drawing, such as trees, grasses, and animals like lizards or fish.
The student can show differences in the types of plants and animals found in each habitat.
The student can organize and label the drawings clearly to show which habitats and living things are represented.
The student can demonstrate patterns by using their drawings to highlight the diversity of life in each habitat.
